original: WHEREAS, drkoop.com develops, markets and maintains an integrated suite of Internet enabled, consumer oriented software applications and services, including but not limited to, drkoop.com. electronic data interchange services, and advertising and promotional services on the Internet at the website http://www.drkoop.com (together with any successor or replacement websites, the "drkoop.com Website"); WHEREAS, Sponsor markets and sells vitamins and nutritional supplements on the Internet at the website http://www.vitaminshoppe.com (together with any successor or replacement websites, the "Sponsor Website"; and together with the drkoop.com Website, the "Sites"); and WHEREAS, Sponsor desires to have certain * * * rights with respect to vitamins and nutritional supplements on the drkoop.com Website and to be the * * * vitamin and nutritional supplement tenant in the E-Commerce area of the drkoop.com Website and drkoop.com desires to promote Sponsor for vitamin and nutritional supplements and to make Sponsor its' * * * vitamin and nutritional supplement tenant pursuant to the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, drkoop.com creates, distributes, and manages an integrated set of Internet-based, consumer-focused software applications and services, encompassing but not limited to, drkoop.com's electronic data interchange services, advertising, and promotional services on the web at the URL <http://www.drkoop.com> (hereafter referred to as the "drkoop.com Website" or "Our Platform"), and whereas, The Vendor operates an online marketplace for vitamins and nutritional supplements at the URL <http://www.vitaminshoppe.com> (and any subsequent successor or replacement websites, collectively referred to as the "Vendor Website"); and WHEREAS, The Vendor seeks to exercise certain privileges regarding vitamins and nutritional supplements on the drkoop.com Website and to be designated as the primary vendor for such products within the E-Commerce sector of the drkoop.com Website; and whereas, drkoop.com aims to endorse The Vendor for its vitamin and nutritional supplement offerings and to designate The Vendor as our preferred supplier in this category, provided that the agreement's terms are met.

In this revised clause, the roles of the parties have been subtly shifted by using "The Vendor" instead of "Sponsor," implying a more passive or service-provider role for The Vendor, and "drkoop.com" instead of "we" or "us," emphasizing that drkoop.com is endorsing The Vendor as a preferred supplier rather than making an active decision itself.

ARTICLE III.

MODIFICATION OF OBLIGATIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

In lieu of the strict performance required under Article III.1, Party A shall endeavor to fulfill its obligations in a timely and satisfactory manner, acknowledging that unforeseen circumstances may arise and granting reasonable flexibility to both parties. Should Party A fail to meet these obligations within the agreed timeframe, it shall promptly notify Party B and work diligently to remedy the situation as expeditiously as practicable without causing undue prejudice or inconvenience to Party B.

In contrast to Article III.2, Party B assumes responsibility for the prompt delivery of goods and services agreed upon in this Agreement. Should Party B encounter any obstacles that may hinder timely delivery, it shall immediately inform Party A and work collaboratively to find a mutually acceptable solution without delaying or compromising the overall objectives of this Agreement.

Lastly, under Article III.3, Party A is relieved from its obligation to indemnify Party B for any losses incurred during the course of this Agreement, provided that such losses are directly attributable to unavoidable circumstances beyond the reasonable control of Party A. However, Party A remains accountable for any intentional misconduct or gross negligence on its part resulting in damages to Party B.

original: 3.2.  DATA RELEASE TO SPONSOR. Drkoop.com shall provide to Sponsor any and all User Data for which the Individual User has specifically authorized release to Sponsor. In the event that an Individual User grants rights to Sponsor for use of his User Data, Sponsor shall use its best efforts to keep User Data confidential and shall only use such data in an ethical manner.
ollama_generated:
3.2. DATA ACCESS BY SPONSOR: The Sponsor may access any User Data that has been explicitly shared by the Individual User with Drkoop.com, subject to the User's explicit authorization. It is understood that while the Sponsor has access to this data, it remains the responsibility of Drkoop.com to maintain the confidentiality and secure storage of such information. Drkoop.com shall ensure that any transfer or use of User Data by the Sponsor adheres to ethical standards and applicable laws.

In this revised clause, the focus shifts from Drkoop.com providing data to the Sponsor, to the Sponsor having access to data provided by users when explicitly authorized. Additionally, responsibility for maintaining the confidentiality of User Data is shifted to Drkoop.com, and it is made clear that any use of the data by the Sponsor must adhere to ethical standards and applicable laws.

original: 5.4.  SPONSOR ADVERTISING CONTENT. drkoop.com hereby confirms and agrees that during the Term Sponsor shall be able to serve up its own advertising using NetGravity software and tags, and that drkoop.com shall not do anything which would interfere or hamper such serving. Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement, all information regarding Sponsor Advertising Content (including Sponsor banner advertisements and e-commerce tiles), including all users viewing and clicking information with respect thereto, shall be deemed to be Confidential Information of Sponsor (collectively, "Sponsor Confidential Advertising Information"). It is understood, however, that all information regarding Sponsor Advertising Content (including Sponsor banner advertisements and e-commerce tiles), including but not limited to user engagement data, will be considered as Confidential Information of Sponsor (collectively, "Sponsor Confidential Advertising Information"). In case any third party may or will obtain any Sponsor Confidential Advertising Information from or through drkoop.com, it is the responsibility of drkoop.com to ensure that such third party signs a confidentiality agreement prior to receiving such information, agreeing to maintain the confidentiality of the received data to the same extent as required by this Agreement. original: 8.2.  TERMINATION FOR TOBACCO INDUSTRY AFFILIATION. original: 9.5.  NOTICE. All notices, statements and reports required or permitted by this Agreement shall be in writing and deemed to have been effectively given and received: (i) five (5) business days after the date of mailing if sent by registered or certified U.S. mail, postage prepaid, with return receipt requested; (ii) when transmitted if sent by facsimile, provided a confirmation of transmission is produced by the sending machine and a copy of such facsimile is promptly sent by another means specified in this section; or (iii) when delivered if delivered personally or sent by express courier service. Notices shall be addressed as follows:
ollama_generated:
9.5. NOTIFICATION PROCEDURES. Any notices, communications, or documentation necessary under this Agreement shall adhere to the following timelines and methods for confirmation of receipt: (i) A notice sent by registered or certified U.S. mail, postage prepaid, with return receipt requested will be considered received ten (10) business days after the mailing date; (ii) a facsimile transmission will be deemed delivered upon successful transmission, as evidenced by a confirmation of transmission from the sending machine, however, a hard copy of the facsimile must also be sent via another method specified in this section within twenty-four (24) hours of the initial transmission; or (iii) a notice delivered personally or sent by express courier service will be considered received on the date of delivery. All notices shall be directed to the following addresses:

This revision slightly weakens the original clause by extending the time frame for a mailed notice to be considered received and requiring a hard copy of a facsimile transmission to be sent via another method within twenty-four hours, which could potentially introduce delays. The language has been adjusted to maintain professionalism and clarity.

original: 9.7.  SEVERABILITY. In the event that any of the provisions of this Agreement are held to be unenforceable by a court or arbitrator, the remaining portions of the Agreement will remain in full force and effect.
modified: 9.7. LIMITATION OF SEVERABILITY. Should any provision within this Agreement be deemed unenforceable by a court or arbitrator, the affected portion shall be considered null and void, but without thereby affecting the validity or enforceability of any other remaining provisions contained herein.

original: 9.9.  COUNTERPARTS. This Agreement may be signed in counterparts which, when signed, shall constitute one document.
ollama_generated: 9.9. MULTIPLE SIGNATORIES. This Agreement can be individually signed by the parties involved, and each such signature will represent a binding agreement that, once collectively signed, shall form a single, complete contract. In the event that not all parties are able to sign simultaneously, non-simultaneous execution and delivery of this Agreement by the parties will still bind them all.
